intro: Gompholobium tetrathecoides, commonly known as the four-valved wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces four-valved pods that release seeds when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
